channel.title: javascript on codehakase's logs
channel.description: Recent content in javascript on codehakase's logs

item.title: JavaScript Async/Await 101
item.description: Async and Await has been a blessing to most JavaScript Developers. Even while it was on the Stage 4 proposal for ES6, the feature has been warmtly welcomed.

item.title: for...in vs for...of Loops in JavaScript
item.description: The for..in and for..of loops, gives us a clean and concise syntax to iterate on iterable items like arrays, strings, objects, and enumerables.

item.title: Making hakasebot - Twitter Bots 101
item.description: ![Bots]({{ site.url }}/images/twitter-bots.gif “Bots”) This was my first attempt making twitter bots. I made a very simple twitter bot for this blog, check the Source and also follow @_hakasebot.

item.title: JavaScript Objects 101
item.description: In JavaScript, most things are objects, from core JavaScript features like strings and arrays to the browser APIs built on top of JavaScript.

item.title: Introduction to JavaScript Promises
item.description: JavaScript promises have become a popular way to handle the tangled mess that JavaScriptâ€™s asynchronous nature often creates for us. Synchronous code is eaiser to follow and debug, async is better for flexibiity.

item.title: Introducing Adonis Js
item.description: TL;DR AdonisJs is a true MVC Framework for Node.js. It encapsulate all the boring parts of Web programming and offers you a nice & clean API to work with.
